definition: of or relating to Flemish people, language or culture
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Hailing from Flanders, these mercenaries are armed with pikes and wear light armour.
sentences.chinese: 佛兰芒矛兵来自佛兰德斯地区，装备轻甲和戟枪。
有些人认为它仅仅只是“佛兰德斯的”的意思。

sentences.english: Hailing from Flanders, these men are armed with pikes and wear light armour.
sentences.chinese: 佛兰芒矛兵来自佛兰德斯地区，装备轻甲和戟枪。

sentences.english: "Mr. Mayor," said the Fleming, "all my horses are good.
sentences.chinese: “市长先生，”那个佛兰德人说，“我的马全是好的。

sentences.english: He used to wear a broad-rimmed hat then with huge Flemish trunk hose .
sentences.chinese: 他经常穿着大佛兰德主干管广泛戴着帽子，然后。

sentences.english: We are obliged to speak in Flemish in all our official meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我们有义务在公务会议上说佛兰德语。

definition: Sachsen or Saxony, Bundesland in east of Germany, bordering on Poland and Czech republic, capital Dresden 德累斯頓|德累斯顿[De2 lei4 si1 dun4]
Flanders, region (state) of Belgium 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
Brittany or Bretagne, area of western France
Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
Gdansk, city on Baltic in north Poland

pinyin: Shen2 sheng4 Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2
